Key Match Events: Ranger Suárez struck out the first five batters — the first Phillies pitcher to achieve that feat since Cole Hamels in 2010
Orlando Arcia hit his 14th homer of the year, and.216-hitting catcher Sean Murphy connected for his eighth homer of the season for a 2-0 lead
Arcia, a noted Phillies tormentor, homered again to a rousing chorus of boos in the sixth off reliever Max Lazar for a 5-0 lead
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies paid respects to Johnny Gaudreau and Matthew Gaudreau, who were killed Thursday night by a suspected drunk driver in New Jersey
Phillies slugger Bryce Harper said he's battled nagging wrist and elbow issues, but it's not anything crazy, but obviously it's there
Harper told MLB.com ahead of the game he's battled nagging wrist and elbow issues
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies manager Rob Thomson said after the game that the two home runs were just mislocations, just balls that leaked back out over the plate and they put good swings on them
Bryce Harper said that the Braves are a really good team and they're playing real good baseball right now
Reynaldo López (8-4) won his second straight start and has seemingly rebounded from an 0-3 June
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves hit at least three home runs in a game for the 26th time this season, the most in the National League
The Phillies' No. 1 and No. 2 hitters, Kyle Schwarber and Trea Turner, were a combined 0-for-8
Pierce Johnson, Joe Jiménez and Dylan Lee preserved the lead a night after the Phillies rallied from a 4-0 hole to beat the Braves 5-4
Others: The Phillies send their deepest condolences to the Gaudreau family, and to the entire NHL family for this seismic loss to their beloved community
